problem.markdown:
1. The voltage across the contacts during the arcing period is known as
() Recovery voltage () Restriking voltage (x) Arc voltage () All
2. The function of __________ is to isolate the part of the power system in case of abnormal conditions.
(x) Circuit Breaker () Isolator () Insulator () All
3. In oil circuit breaker (O.C.B) the range exists between
() 250MVA at 2.5 kV and 5000MVA at 250kV () 7.5MVA at 2.5 kV and 50000MVA at 250kV (x) 25MVA at 2.5 kV and 5000MVA at 250kV () 75MVA at 2.5 kV and 50000MVA at 250kV
4. The transient voltage appearing across the contacts during arc period is called ________
() Recovery voltage () Arc voltage (x) Restriking voltage () All
5. _________ is the r.m.s value of current which the Circuit breaker is capable of carrying continuously at its rated frequency under specified conditions.
() Short-time capacity () Making capacity (x) None () Breaking capacity
